descriptions.description: More core developers increase the availability of mentors, facilitating implicit knowledge transfer.
A larger pool of new contributors increases the potential inflow of individuals who can become experienced.
As new contributors skill up, they flow out of the 'New Contributors' stock and into a more experienced category.
Developer turnover directly reduces the stock of core developers as they leave the project.
A higher promotion rate increases the core developer stock by moving experienced contributors into core roles.
A higher promotion rate decreases the stock of experienced contributors as they are promoted to core developers.
The skill-up flow increases the stock of experienced contributors by moving new contributors into this category.
Better explicit documentation accelerates learning, increasing the rate at which contributors skill up.
Effective mentorship accelerates practical skill development, increasing the rate at which contributors skill up.
Effective mentorship prepares experienced contributors for core responsibilities, increasing their promotion rate.
